description: Single storey side/rear extension; rear roof extension incorporating two Juliet balcony and installation of three roof lights to front roof slope
decision_conditions: The development to which this permission relates shall be begun not later than the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.

Reason: To comply with Section 91 of the Town & Country Planning Act 1990. | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing / document title number(s): Proposed Floor Plans drawing no.229-103 Rev A  and Proposed Elevations Proposed Floor Plans drawing no.229-104 Rev A
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt and in the interests of proper planning.
| All external materials to be used in the development shall match the existing property and as per submitted application form and Condition 2: Approved plans.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies D3 and D4 of the London Plan (2021) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2021) - section 12. | No part of the flat roof of the existing extension shall be used as or altered to form a balcony, roof terrace/garden or similar amenity area.

Reason: To protect the living conditions of occupants of nearby properties and future occupiers of the development, in accordance with policies 7A ,7B and 7D of the Ealing Development Management Plan (2013) and policies D3 and D6 of the London Plan 2021.

| Notwithstanding the provisions of Article 3 of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 1995 (as amended), no windows or other openings (other than those shown on the submitted plans) shall be formed in the walls of the extension permitted.

Reason: To protect the living conditions of neighbouring properties and the visual appearance of the area, in accordance with policies 7.4 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013) and policies D3 and D6 of the London Plan (2021).
